summary: This bill, the Adoption Tax Credit Refundability Act of 2025, amends the Internal Revenue Code to make the adoption tax credit refundable. This means taxpayers could receive money back even if they owe no taxes. It renumbers and relocates the relevant section of the tax code and includes conforming amendments throughout. The bill also includes provisions for third-party affidavits to verify adoptions and sets the effective date for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025, alongside transitional rules for carryforwards.
